body.name: The Worst Ship in the Fleet (Dumb Luck and Dead Heroes Book 1)

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #1,767 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #4 in Galactic Empire Science Fiction eBooks #6 in Space Fleet Science Fiction eBooks #6 in Space Marine Science Fiction

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Dumb Luck and Dead Heroes He's a screwup who killed over 500 civilians. And now he's on the last drunken stop of his quickly imploding naval career, commanding the Persephone, the worst ship in His Majesty's fleet. She was a bright rising star in the Promethean Navy, until something changed all of that. Now she's lost more than just her confidence. Together, they may have just enough left in them to pull out one more victory for the Crown. But the cost could be their lives.

Naval Officers Exiled to HMS Persephone, Brad and Jessica must find a way to destroy a ship three times their size with ten times their firepower. But Brad will need to sober up first. Read The Worst Ship in the Fleet now! Spies Join Brad and Jessica at the Rishi Paradise Casino as they race against the clock to find a spy and save their own lives from a vicious mercenary and his minions. Read The Worst Spies in the Sector now! Pirate Hunters When a small system can't afford a proper set of mercenaries, Brad and Jessica must find a way to take down a band of ruthless pirates using nothing but an unarmed ship, a makeup artist, and a couple of pistols. Read The Worst Pirate Hunters in the Fringe! Mercenaries What do you do when you have no money, few discernible skills, and zero prospects? You find someone willing to pay you to fly a ship and shoot things. Join Brad and Jessica on their many action-packed and hilarious misadventures across the galaxy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I surf the recommendations Amazon feeds me, rejecting most after a few pages for their obvious lack of skill or character development, and have rarely found one as great as this. Short, but definitely a page turner. Getting the next in the series right now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Just plain fun
reviews.reviewText: Can’t give a 4-star, that is reserved for the Peter Hamiltons of the scifi world. But I did like your light, tongue-in-cheek approach and I don’t see often that - reminds me a bit of the Stainless Steel Rat series. Keep up the fun.My only complaint is a common one, but it happens. Please avoid multiple character names all starting with name letter. In book 1 you have Jessica, Jessup, several starting with “J”. I am one of those minority readers who like to semi-skip read. I don’t skip anything important but it helps speed things up in my mind if I don’t need to read the character names repeatedly. Just spot the first letter then get on to the narrative. Using multiple “J”s forces me to re-read some paragraphs to reorient the characters - oh, that was Jessup, not Jessica, etc. I don’t think there is any underlying reason for multiple first-letter names so I suggest getting more variety.

reviews.reviewerName: James Hayes, AKA The Wise Dragon
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars For a short story, "Great Ending" . Makes me want to read more!
reviews.reviewText: While the book initially makes a bad impression, it moves quickly. I have to say " What a spectacular ending!" Totally unexpected! Now if the Captain and his first mate can just keep the momentum going! I'm hooked! Now I have to read the next installment! Let's see if two disgraced officers can turn the tides. On to the next one. ------------------------- J

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice little book
reviews.reviewText: I gave it 4 stars Because I wanted the story to be much longer .how nicely interesting this story was . I am ordering me the second book. On a cool note the book is stamp in the back when it was printed .. its the Same day I put the order in how cool is this freshly new copy directed to the reader . "Me" would I recommend this short story book to anyone yes I will .I enjoyed it very much thank you

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: There were at least one too many improbable things happening in the space soap opera. The fact that two competent officer's careers were terminated by speculative circumstances by dubious higher-ups is odd by itself. Add to that the many strange actions leading to a rather explosive ending leads to the conclusion that this is just a setup for a series.I wouldn't go so far as calling this a good read but it was okay but not quite Syfy.It also has a British flavor that that over achieving island nation is now running Earth's government and space programs that truly is fictional.Not all is lost. The main characters are entertaining and the writing if not the premise is good.It was good enough to try the next book before abandoning ship.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars WHAT A GREAT READ FOR ALL AGES
reviews.reviewText: If you like a good military sci-fi book that will keep you interested throughout, is full of twists and turns, and the stories main characters are a group of misfits, you are going to love this book."THE WORST SHIP IN THE FLEET" A Military Science Fiction Adventure! DUMB LUCK and DEAD HEROES series By Skyler Ramirez is well written their is no language that that make it inappropriate for younger audiences, and Skyler writes the action scenes without being graphic for those that really don't need all the blood and gore to get them to read what I would call a great book and a great start to hopefully, a great series. This is the first book that I have read by Skyler Ramirez and can safely say it will not be my last and I can't wait to find out what happens to Captain Brad Mendoza and Lieutenant Commander Jessica Lin. I really enjoyed reading this book and hope you will also.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars From ho hum to hidden honor 🎖
reviews.reviewText: Brad Mendoza is a disgraced naval captain assigned to the last failed class of a ship. He and Jessica Lin acquit themselves along with most of the crew. They foil a traitor with a fake message. Saying too much will spoil the plot. So read 📚 it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This is a novella
reviews.reviewText: I thought this was great fun to read. This is a quick-to-read story about a naval officer (space navy) in disgrace who is ordered to take command of 'The Worst Ship in the Fleet.' He is divorced, drunk, and on a downward spiral. But by dumb luck, he sorts out an encounter with more powerful hostile ships. I read this short fiction in a day, then ordered out the next in the series and read it too! If you want an enjoyable read, this is it.

This book surprised me. I found it to be a very enjoyable read. I was left with plenty of wants, though…- I wanted to know the history of several of the characters.- I wanted more on one of the characters that played a small but vitally important part in the story.- I wanted more on the world building, because it seems quite interesting indeed!- I wanted…. well, more of everything!Great story. I’m happy the author decided to turn it into a series. Wish the books were longer, though!
Not entirely sure why I picked up this book. Upto 59% it’s pure nonsense after which I skipped and went to rating the book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I loved this book. I was feeling quite apathetic about getting into it when suddenly I found myself enjoying it and the outrageous apathy of the captain. It was a great story with great characters and I look forward to reading more.

reviews.reviewTitle: The beginning of a great adventure
reviews.reviewText: This was a very well written book. I have not read this author before. Certainly, i will be reading many, many more.
I liked the characters and the realness given to them. The plot was quick enough but well developed. I honestly can't wait to read further into this world being created
